page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN RURAL WILTSHIRE
page.content:
Public transport in this area is very sparse and the majority of households in the block have a car of necessity. There is a bus service daily between Cricklade and Malmesbury, and a school bus in term time between Ashton Keynes and Braydon Forest School in Purton. Although there is no station nearby, the main Swindon to Gloucester railway line runs through the block. In August of 1985 a number of steam trains were run along this line to celebrate 150 years of the Great Western Railway.
THE INFORMATION FOR THIS BLOCK WAS RESEARCHED AND PRODUCED BY THE LADIES OF THE{ASHTON KEYNES WOMENS INSTITUTE WITH THE KIND ASSISTANCE OF LOCAL RESIDENTS.
